file_content.text: Come in, Major. This is General Garza. The situation on Belsavis is complicated, so let's begin immediately.
Belsavis houses a top secret prison colony for the worst offenders in the Republic--Sith Lords, war criminals and mass murderers.
That prison is under heavy assault--the Imperials are attempting to free their captured comrades. While you're in the field, do whatever you can to impede them.
I get the impression the prison break isn't why I'm here.
Tell me my primary objective.
How did the Imperials hear about our top secret prison?
Who tipped the Imps off?
Unknown. The Empire has its spies, just as we have ours.
Why fight to hold people we don't want? Why not bomb the whole prison?
Sounds like a waste of time.
Not everyone in the Republic shares your outlook on prisoner management.
Your primary objective is to extract the pilots of Dagger Wing, an elite navy starfighter unit, from within the prison zone and return them to service.
Were these pilots shot down? Will they need medical attention?
Give me their situation.
They weren't sent to Belsavis on a mission. They're inmates.
We can swap war stories.
Sounds like fun.
Socialize on your own time, Major. This is an important operation.
If these guys aren't army, why are we involved?
Why can't the navy do this?
Ground-based extractions are generally handled by the army, regardless of who is being extracted.
The pilots of Dagger Wing are serving life sentences on Belsavis for participating in an unauthorized bombing mission that killed thousands of Imperial civilians.
The attack was so brutal that High Command had no choice but to disavow the incident and sweep away the pilots responsible--permanently.
Why did they target civilians?
Did Dagger Wing go rogue?
Dagger Wing thought they were acting in the Republic's best interests at the time. But results far outweigh intentions.
If we locked these guys up for life, what are the odds they'll fly for us?
They might hold a grudge.
Freedom is an excellent bargaining tool.
Is there ever a mistake you people don't try to hide?
Just one more cover-up.
Decisions from High Command are not open to debate.
The Republic needs Dagger Wing back in the fight, regardless of their past crimes. Starfighter pilots of their caliber are in very short supply.
A prison guard captain named Zess will direct you to Dagger Wing's CO, Conrad Gall. Contact him, extract the pilots and then report back to me. Garza out.
